PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
A.  Justification 
1.  Project preparatory technical assistance (PPTA) is required to help WSD prepare a 
mutually agreeable project suitable for ADB financing. The PPTA will (i) prepare an investment 
project with technical soundness and economical viable by a ADB loan; (ii) conduct required 
due diligence; and (iii) assist the EA in developing required documentation for country resource 
allocation including PC-1 for submission to the Planning Commission.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement 
2.  The TA is estimated to cost $700,000 which will be financed on a grant basis by ADB’s 
technical assistance special fund (TASF-V). The Government will provide in-kind contributions 
of counterpart staff (technical, administrative, and secretarial assigned not only to PMU but also 
to consultant team), office space, office equipment (work stations and printer), communications 
(local call and internet connection), and office supplies. The Government was advised that

approval of the TA does not commit ADB to financing any ensuing project. The detailed cost 
estimate is presented in Table A4.2.

D.  Consulting Services 
3.  The  TA  will  be  implemented  by  a  combined  team  of  individual  consultants  and  a 
consortium of international and national consulting firm over a 6-month period, commencing 
from September 2013. The firm will be hired using quality- and cost-based selection with a 
quality to cost ratio of 90:10. The type of technical proposal format will be Simplified Technical 
Proposal. 
 
4.  In order to synchronize the project readiness and loan effectiveness, several individual 
consultants  will  be  engaged  for quick mobilization,  so  that  advanced procurement  can  be 
initiated  earlier. Two  sets  of  consultants  will  be  recruited  separately: (i)  3  international  as 
individual; and (ii) 2 international and 9 national consultants as a firm. The expertise and 
person-months of international and national consultants are as follows:

5.  The outline terms of reference for the project preparatory TA consultants are described 
in Annex 1. 
 
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
6.  The executing agency (EA) will be WSD, and a project management unit (PMU) will be 
established for overall implementation of the TA including supervision of consultants. The PMU 
will be headed by a project director and be assigned with suitably qualified staff to assist 
consultants.  WSD  will  be  responsible  for  providing  government’s  in-kind  contributions  of 
counterpart staff (technical, administrative, and secretarial assigned not only to PMU but also to 
consultant team), office space, office equipment (work stations and printer), communications 
(local call and internet connection), and office supplies.
